thread.title: Bricklayer Leads Semi-Pro Sutton United To FA Cup Fifth Round
thread.title_full: Bricklayer Leads Semi-Pro Sutton United To FA Cup Fifth Round

author: Timothy Burke on Screengrabber, shared by Timothy Burke to Deadspin
title: Bricklayer Leads Semi-Pro Sutton United To FA Cup Fifth Round
text:
Go to permalink 
Non-league Sutton United continued its miraculous run through the FA Cup with a 1-0 win over Championship side Leeds United thanks to a penalty scored by team captain Jamie Collins, who earns a living with his day job as a bricklayer . Advertisement 
Sutton United’s manager is an unpaid sponsor of the team who vapes during matches . The team plays in a stadium with a capacity of just 5,000—of whom fewer than 800 actually have seats. They will join fellow fifth-division side Lincoln City in the fifth round after the latter’s victory over Brighton & Hove Albion. 
[Fox Deportes]
